abstract_summ: This cross-sectional study used reverse transcriptase–polymerase chain reaction tests to assess potential viral shedding among patients who previously had been diagnosed with and had clinically recovered from coronavirus disease 2019.This case series describes the characteristics of a cohort of patients who died of coronavirus disease 2019 in China.This case series study assesses the seasonality of respiratory viral infections among different age groups in Rhode Island from 2012 to 2016.The coronavirus disease (COVID‐19) first emerged in Wuhan, China, in December 2019 and rapidly infected a large number of individuals, and disease clusters have spread worldwide.This case series examines patients with coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) who were discharged from the hospital and had recurrent positive reverse transcriptase–polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) results.This case series examines clinical characteristics of patients with asymptomatic vs symptomatic coronavirus disease 2019 in Wuhan, China.This cohort study examines the clinical characteristics of men with coronavirus disease 2019 whose semen tested positive for severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2.
title_summ: Coronavirus Disease 2019 Test Results After Clinical Recovery and Hospital Discharge Among Patients in ChinaClinical Characteristics of Patients Who Died of Coronavirus Disease 2019 in ChinaComparison of Common Respiratory Virus Peak Incidence Among Varying Age Groups in Rhode Island, 2012-2016Infection risk in a gastroenterological ward during a nosocomial COVID‐19 infection eventRecurrent Positive Reverse Transcriptase–Polymerase Chain Reaction Results for Coronavirus Disease 2019 in Patients Discharged From a Hospital in ChinaComparison of Clinical Characteristics of Patients with Asymptomatic vs Symptomatic Coronavirus Disease 2019 in Wuhan, ChinaClinical Characteristics and Results of Semen Tests Among Men With Coronavirus Disease 2019
